PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. Marvin Patrick, 5219 Broad Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 11, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe youngsters in their early teens, that is from 13 to 16 years of age, should be permitted to smoke cigarettes or drink alcoholic beverages?" answer reads: " I was about 40 years of age when I began smoking cigarettes. For youngsters about 19 years old it is not so bad, but for those between 13 and 16 years- well, they are too young."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Marvin Patrick wearing dark hat, moustache, plaid shirt, and herringbone coat, standing in front of light colored clapboard house
